simp.c

00001 /* ---- simp.c --- example of using save and restore to save something in patcher files.
00002     
00003     NOTE: Do NOT use the symbol "save" in a method unless you want
00004     to save something in a patcher. Your object will crash or 
00005     corrupt patcher files otherwise. 
00006     
00007     updated 6/6/95
00008     updated for CodeWarrior 11/08/96
00009     updated for CodeWarrior Pro6/PPC 03/26/01
00010     
00011 -- */
00012 
00013 #include "ext.h"
00014 
00015 /* data structure */
00016 
00017 typedef struct _simp
00018 {
00019     t_object s_ob;      // object header
00020     long s_state;       // internal state to save
00021     long s_arg;         // argument typed in by the user
00022 } t_simp;
00023 
00024 /* prototypes */
00025 
00026 void main(void);
00027 void simp_bang(t_simp *x);
00028 void simp_int(t_simp *x, long n);
00029 void simp_save(t_simp *x, void *w);
00030 void simp_restore(t_simp *x, long n);
00031 void *simp_new(long n);
00032 
00033 /* globals */
00034 
00035 t_symbol *ps_X; // global symbol #X to which we will bind our object
00036 void *simp_class;
00037 
00038 /* class initialization */
00039 
00040 void main(void)
00041 {
00042     setup((t_messlist **)&simp_class, (method)simp_new, (method)0L, (short)sizeof(t_simp), 0L, A_DEFLONG, 0);
00043     addbang((method)simp_bang);
00044     addint((method)simp_int);
00045     addmess((method)simp_save,      "save",     A_CANT, 0);     // needed to save state
00046     addmess((method)simp_restore,   "restore",  A_LONG, 0);     // used to restore state
00047     finder_addclass("Control","simp");
00048     ps_X = gensym("#X");            // symbol that we will use for restore
00049 }
00050 
00051 /* report state */
00052 
00053 void simp_bang(t_simp *x)
00054 {
00055     post("my state is %ld",x->s_state);
00056 }
00057 
00058 /* change state and report */
00059 
00060 void simp_int(t_simp *x, long n)
00061 {
00062     post("changing state to %ld",n);
00063     x->s_state = n;
00064 }
00065 
00066 /* save state with patcher */
00067 /* Note that any arguments typed into the object box by the user will usually need to be stored 
00068         in our object's data structure so they can be recalled and saved with the patcher
00069         in the _save method.  Note that it is the information on the first line (beginning with #N)
00070         which is used to create an instance of our object when the patcher file is read.
00071 */
00072 
00073 void simp_save(t_simp *x, void *w)
00074 {
00075     post("simp is saving...");
00076     binbuf_vinsert(w,"ssl",gensym("#N"),gensym("simp"),x->s_arg);       // recreate an instance of simp
00077     binbuf_vinsert(w,"ssl",ps_X,gensym("restore"),x->s_state);  // send it a message to set its state
00078     
00079     // Max will automatically add a standard #P line goving the object box's location in the patch
00080     //      as well as the object's name and arguments as they were originally typed in by the user
00081 }
00082 
00083 /* called when file is read in to restore state */
00084 
00085 void simp_restore(t_simp *x, long n)
00086 {
00087     x->s_state = n;
00088     ps_X->s_thing = 0;      // remove binding -- somewhat important, though not strictly necesary
00089     post("simp restored to %ld",n); 
00090 }
00091 
00092 /* instance creation function */
00093 
00094 void *simp_new(long n)
00095 {
00096     t_simp *x;
00097 
00098     x = (t_simp *)newobject(simp_class);
00099     x->s_arg = n;                           // store our integer argumet (A_DEFLONG defaults to 0)
00100     x->s_state = n;                         // initialize our state (will be modified when file is read in)
00101     ps_X->s_thing = (t_object *)x;          // bind the object to the symbol #X 
00102                                             // so it'll receive the restore message saved with the patch
00103     return (x);
00104 }
00105
